resources.string: Automatically download attachments for incoming emails
Only download attachments when manually requested
We\'re here to help you improve your yoga practice with real-time feedback on your poses. Get started by setting up your camera and start practicing!

Explore the various yoga poses, learn about correct alignments, and understand the benefits of each pose. Whether you are a beginner or an experienced yogi, you\'ll find helpful advice to enhance your practice.
From stress management to improving flexibility and balance, discover how yoga can contribute to your overall wellbeing.
Provide your account email that you want to reset the password!\n
Please check your email for instructions! (Make sure to check spam)
Checkout the Below Cards for Instructions on How to Use our App in order to Check your Pose.
Checkout some more content on How to Strike the Perfect Pose!
Select a Pose to begin checking your Accuracy\n
Wait for Verbal & on Screen Feedback and
Then you will be redirected towards your Result.

☑ Stretches the chest, neck, and spine.
☑ Stimulates abdominal organs, lungs, and thyroids.
☑ Improves digestion.
☑ Relieves menstrual discomfort when done supported.
☑ Reduces anxiety, fatigue, backache, headache, and insomnia. "

☑ Strengthens the abdomen, hip flexors, and spine. 
☑ Stimulates the kidneys, thyroid and intestines. 
☑ Helps relieve stress. 
☑ Improves digestion.

1. From a seated position the feet are lifted up so that the thighs are angled about 45-50 degrees relative to the earth. 
2.The legs are straight. 
3. The tailbone is lengthened into the earth and the pubis pulls toward the navel. 
4. The shoulder blades are spread across the back and the hands reach straight forward making the arms are parallel to the earth. 
5. The chin is tipped slightly toward the sternum so that the base of the skull lifts lightly away from the back of the neck. 
6. Gaze is forward.

1. From a supine position, on your back, the hips are pressed up with the heels of the feet rooted into the earth close to the sits bones. 
2. The toes are actively lifted and the pelvis tucked. 
3. The thighs are parallel to the earth and the fingers are interlaced under the body with the ribcage lifted and the heart open. 
4. The back of the neck rests on the earth. 
5. The gaze is to the sky.

1. Both arms reach outward with a light stretch. 
2. Arms should be 90 degrees to body.
3. The knees, hips and shoulders aligned. 
4. Feet planted and forward.
5. The gaze is forward.

1. From a standing position, the legs are separated into a wide stance. 
2. The front knee is bent in a 90-degree angle directly above the ankle. 
3. The back leg is extended and straight with the outside edge of the back foot gripping the earth in a 60-degree angle toward the front. 
4. The inner thighs are externally rotated away from each other. 
5. The arms are extended out to the sides and are aligned with the shoulders in a straight line with the fingers reaching out. 
6. The gaze is toward the front fingers.

☑ Strengthens and stretches the legs and ankles.
☑ Stretches the chest, lungs, and shoulders.
☑ Stimulates abdominal organs. 
☑ Relieves backaches. 
☑ Therapeutic for carpal tunnel syndrome, and sciatica.
